definition: to climb over/to ascend onto/to mount

to scale (a height)/to ascend/to mount/to publish or record/to enter (e.g. in a register)/to press down with the foot/to step or tread on/to put on (shoes or trousers) (dialect)/to be gathered and taken to the threshing ground (old)
on top/upon/above/upper/previous/first (of multiple parts)/to climb/to get onto/to go up/to attend (class or university)
see 上聲|上声[shang3 sheng1]

sentences.english: That's true.And more Chinese step on the cover of "Times".
sentences.chinese: 沒錯，而且越來越多的中國人登上了時代週刊封面。

sentences.english: It seemed like a long ascent to the top.
sentences.chinese: 登上山頂的路好長好長。

sentences.english: Many would like to board the mountains, Wang Jin End of the World Acacia color.
sentences.chinese: 多想登上高山，望盡天涯相思的顏色。

sentences.english: I'll choose a good horse to climb the mountain.
sentences.chinese: 我要挑一匹好馬登上山去。

sentences.english: He hurried behind the other Blue Team members to get aboard their own transport.
sentences.chinese: 他也趕快緊隨其他藍隊成員登上他們自己的飛行器。

sentences.english: Climb down nets, and embark the lifeboat over manropes, everyone.
sentences.chinese: 每個人爬下救生網，用扶手繩登上救生艇。

sentences.english: After succeeding in landing on George Island, the captain sent a radio message to his headquarters.
sentences.chinese: 勝利登上喬治島後，船長向指揮部發了一份無線電報。

sentences.english: They climbed a mountain whose peak was covered with snow.
sentences.chinese: 他們登上了覆蓋着雪的那座山的峯頂。
他的書登上了暢銷榜首。

sentences.english: When you climb up to the balcony of the drum tower, you are at the central point of Old Tianjin.
sentences.chinese: 登上鼓樓的觀景臺，你就站在了天津的中心。

sentences.english: The movie star was warmly cheered as he got on the stage.
sentences.chinese: 這位影星登上舞臺時受到人們的熱烈歡呼。

sentences.english: Nine men and eleven women climbed the mountains in the snow.
sentences.chinese: 九個男人和十一個女人在雪天登上了山。

sentences.english: This helps simulate changing gears when you run up a hill during a race.
sentences.chinese: 這是模擬您在比賽過程中登上坡頂之時“更換排擋”。

sentences.english: Matt agreed, and got into the small airplane with his wife.
sentences.chinese: 麥特同意了，他和妻子一起登上了飛機。

sentences.english: The team had hiked through the night and reached Mount Rainier 's summit at dawn.
sentences.chinese: 這支隊伍徹夜攀登，破曉時登上雷尼爾山的頂峯。

sentences.english: Queen Victoria ascended ascended the throne in 1837.
sentences.chinese: 維多利亞女王於1837年登上王位。

definition: to scale (a height)/to ascend/to mount/to publish or record/to enter (e.g. in a register)/to press down with the foot/to step or tread on/to put on (shoes or trousers) (dialect)/to be gathered and taken to the threshing ground (old)
(of a list, music chart etc) to reach the top
to set foot on/to step on or into
throne
stage/arena/fig. in the limelight
(winner's) podium
laurel/victory garland (in Greek and Western culture)
to aspire to the throne/to aim at (the first place etc)
to take (after a struggle)/to wrest/to seize/to capture/to win (a trophy)
notice or announcement/list of names/public roll of successful examinees
to row/oar/Taiwan pr. [beng4]
to whip/Taiwan pr. [beng4]
China Central Television (CCTV), abbr. for 中國中央電視台|中国中央电视台[Zhong1 guo2 Zhong1 yang1 Dian4 shi4 tai2]
to win instant success (idiom)/to become an instant hit
to amaze the world with a single brilliant feat (idiom); an overnight celebrity
to continue in a post/(to hold a post) several times in succession/(to win a title) in successive years/to stay at number one/to defend a championship
peak/summit/fig. high point/masterpiece
to fight in one place after another
